reference.title: ID_MMFR4_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 4, EL1
reference.shortdesc: The ID_MMFR4_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32.

section.title: Bit field descriptions
section.p: ID_MMFR4_EL1 is a 32-bit register, and is part of the Identification registers functional group.

dlentry.dd:
Load/Store Multiple. Indicates whether adjacent loads or stores can be combined. The value is:
0 LSMAOE and nTLSMD bit not supported.

dd.p: Presence of Hierarchical Disables. Enables an operating system or hypervisor to hand over up to 4 bits of the last level page table descriptor (bits[62:59] of the page table entry) for use by hardware for IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED usage. The value is:
Hierarchical Permission Disables and Hardware allocation of bits[62:59] supported.

dlentry.dd:
Common Not Private. Indicates support for selective sharing of TLB entries across multiple PEs. The value is:
1 CnP bit supported.

Execute Never. Indicates whether the stage 2 translation tables allows the stage 2 control of whether memory is executable at EL1 independent of whether memory is executable at EL0. The value is:
1 EL0/EL1 execute control distinction at stage2 bit supported.

Indicates the extension of the ACTLR and HACTLR registers using ACTLR2 and HACTLR2. The value is:
1 ACTLR2 and HACTLR2 are implemented.

Describes whether the core can generate SError interrupt exceptions from speculative reads of memory, including speculative instruction fetches. The value is:
0 The core never generates an SError interrupt due to an external abort on a speculative read.

dd.p: There is one copy of this register that is used in both Secure and Non-secure states.
Must be interpreted with ID_MMFR0_EL1, ID_MMFR1_EL1, ID_MMFR2_EL1, and ID_MMFR3_EL1. See:

ul.li: ID_MMFR0_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 0, EL1The ID_MMFR0_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32..
ID_MMFR1_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 1, EL1The ID_MMFR1_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32..
ID_MMFR2_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 2, EL1The ID_MMFR2_EL1 provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32..
ID_MMFR3_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 3, EL1The ID_MMFR3_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32..

section.p: Bit fields and details that are not provided in this description are architecturally defined. See the Arm Architecture Reference Manual Armv8, for Armv8-A architecture profile.
